"d14ffe2aa66145bab13216ae0bcd1380_155"}, {"start": 36824, "end": 37008, "text": "The Reserve Bank did not undertake that it will not take any steps for bringing about total integration of the clerical services until all the transferee Grade II Clerks were promoted.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "327358a83e86452481a6bd8fbc146c38_156"}, {"start": 37009, "end": 37335, "text": "The Reserve Bank was entitled to introduce the Combined Seniority Scheme at any time it though fit and the validity of the Combined Seniority Scheme cannot be assailed on the ground that it was intro duced at a time when some of the transferee Grade II Clerks still remained to be promoted and was discriminatory against them.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "30db190158834744b8d322b5afe964b7_157"}, {"start": 37336, "end": 37532, "text": "It may be that some transferee Grade I1 Clerks had already obtained promotion as Grade I Clerks by the time the Combined Seniority Scheme was introduced, while others like the petitioners had not.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "1ac8fac99ae24cd7b1a046a340133d90_158"}, {"start": 37533, "end": 37559, "text": "But that cannot be helped.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "9a84c56cc830449c8f85cc80c79997f0_159"}, {"start": 37560, "end": 37652, "text": "It is all part of the incidence of service and in law, no griev ance can be made against it.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "fe14164955fe4e1aad244335cb606576_160"}, {"start": 37653, "end": 37768, "text": "That takes us to the last ground of challenge which relates to integration of non clerical with clerical serv ices.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "9f5859a61ae44a539aabbf34995a34ef_161"}, {"start": 37769, "end": 38445, "text": "This ground of challenge was advanced under three heads: first, non clerical services and clerical services were wholly different from each other and by integrating them into one cadre, the Reserve Bank failed to recognise their differences and treated unequals as equals, thereby offending the equality clause of the Constitution secondly, by permitting, in case of non clerical staff, one third of the total non clerical service until 7th May, 1972 and in case of those who become graduates or pass both parts of institute of Bankers Examination subsequent to 7th May, 1972 until the date of acquiring such qualification to be taken into account for the purpose of seniority", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "3c11e1a6687c4e4390223ddf3b507a35_162"}, {"start": 38446, "end": 38858, "text": ", the Reserve Bank laid down a wholly irrational and unjust principle of sen iority in the integrated service and thereby violated the equal opportunity clause and lastly, the seniority of the petitioners was adversely affected by the integration with out giving any opportunity to them to represent against it and the Combined Seniority Scheme was, therefore, in viola tion of the principles of natural justice.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "2b3bbacfe18e423a9501d2b1577b3f99_163"}, {"start": 38859, "end": 38960, "text": "We have careful ly examined these three heads of challenge, but we do not find any substance in them.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "9d88250d04a94bab89342e3d87f35063_164"}, {"start": 38961, "end": 39094, "text": "They are based on a misconcep tion of the true nature of the process involved in integra tion of non clerical with clerical services.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "e2ddfda5926a4e879f2316b1f7c6c58a_165"}, {"start": 39095, "end": 39335, "text": "There was, as already 393 pointed out above, a non clerical cadre in each Department of the Reserve Bank and it was decided by the Reserve Bank that the nonclerical cadres in all the Departments should be integrated with the clerical cadre.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "e3f56f8e9c5d4ae090d3d884005a1022_166"}, {"start": 39336, "end": 39730, "text": "With that end in view, the Combined Seniority Scheme gave an option to all employ ees in non clerical cadres to be transferred to posts in the clerical cadre, but in the interest of efficiency, pre scribed a qualification that only those employees in non clerical cadres would be entitled to be transferred who are either graduates or have passed both parts of Institute of Bankers Examination.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "6e8efd6813c84d988450c45e21f1d2bc_167"}, {"start": 39731, "end": 39919, "text": "Now, when the employees from non clerical cadres are admitted in the clerical cadre, some rule would have to be made for determining their seniori ty vis a vis those in the clerical cadre.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "88e9e5fad4b54c6c9f553df568a02273_168"}, {"start": 39920, "end": 40079, "text": "They would have to be fitted into the clerical cadre and for that purpose, some rule would have to be devised for determining how they shall rank in seniority.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "da7a02a4d3bb43d7b40e424529ac3185_169"}, {"start": 40080, "end": 40388, "text": "The Combined Seniority Scheme adopted the rule that for determining the seniority of non clerical staff who exercised the option and were admit ted in the clerical cadre, one third of their total non clerical service \"until 7th May, 1972 or the date of acquir ing qualification\" should be taken into account.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "83a34a2f883a47998fc38c6619ae7ec9_170"}, {"start": 40389, "end": 40562, "text": "This was the manner in which the Combined Seniority Scheme sought to bring about integration of non clerical with. clerical serv ices in the several departments of the Bank.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "4e3cb2a561c745908f5a02cf4be523e3_171"}, {"start": 40563, "end": 40767, "text": "Now, the first question which arises for consideration is whether the Reserve Bank violated the constitutional princi ple of equality in bringing about integration of non cleri cal with clerical services.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "720806a1390f4cc69ee0cef72b8238d4_172"}, {"start": 40768, "end": 40894, "text": "We fail to see how integration of different cadres into one cadre can be said to involve any violation of the equality clause.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "c31ec2728575422ebeb138528cca06bf_173"}, {"start": 40895, "end": 41123, "text": "It is now well set tled, as a result of the decision of this Court in Kishori Mohanlal Bakshi vs Union of India(1) that Article 16 a fortiori also Article 14 do not forbid the creation of different cadres for government service.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "d17927df4b1b44598dab8e63f2c63058_174"}, {"start": 41124, "end": 41251, "text": "And if that be so, equally these two Articles cannot stand in the way of the State integrating different cadres into one cadre.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "88e8244c3cb349fcabd8315c73559f6b_175"}, {"start": 41252, "end": 41381, "text": "It is entirely a matter for the State to decide whether to have several different cadres or one integrated cadre in its services.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "c1bcdf4cadfa41b791d1bf20274c5517_176"}, {"start": 41382, "end": 41473, "text": "That is a matter of policy which does not attract the applicability of the equality clause.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "a902abb03fb746bf9c640f231949575e_177"}, {"start": 41474, "end": 41684, "text": "The integration of non clerical with clerical services sought to be effectuated by the Combined Seniority Scheme cannot in the circumstances be assailed as violative of the constitutional principle of equality.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "215bf0e6e93a452788a9f2413ee0c76a_178"}, {"start": 41685, "end": 41780, "text": "Then we come to the question of the rule of seniority adopted by the Combined Seniority Scheme.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "a20d9fd2d6184ecf8520c0084129a279_179"}, {"start": 41781, "end": 42074, "text": "Now there can be no doubt that it is open to the State to lay down any rule which it thinks appropriate for determining seniority in service and it is not competent to the Court to strike down such rule on the ground that in its opinion another rule would have been better or more appropriate.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "5617cfc09a1c4114a07e197c5c9e81af_180"}, {"start": 42075, "end": 42283, "text": "The only en quiry which the Court can make is whether the rule laid down by the State is arbitrary and irrational so that it results in inequality of opportunity amongst employees belonging to the same class.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "5e4a668d06c342b1b939d60c078bf704_181"}, {"start": 42284, "end": 42523, "text": "Now, here, employees from non clerical cadres were being absorbed in the clerical cadre and, there fore, a rule for determining their seniority vis a vis (1) A.I.R. 1962 S.C. 1139. 394 those already in the clerical cadre had to be devised.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "4a0664fcb07f4e2a83659f09ee6b1f7b_182"}, {"start": 42524, "end": 42676, "text": "Obviously, if the non clerical service rendered by the ' employees from non clerical cadres were wholly ignored, it would have been most unjust to them.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "a668dfa6b52d4a3a87c37b7d2d9f0945_183"}, {"start": 42677, "end": 42965, "text": "Equally, it would have been unjust to employees in the clerical cadre, if the entire non clerical service of those coming from non cleri cal cadres were taken into account, for non clerical service cannot be equated with clerical service and the two cannot be treated on the same footing.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "639844e6ed734fe08acb8d89eb00073c_184"}, {"start": 42966, "end": 43167, "text": "Reserve Bank, therefore, decided that one third of the non clerical service ren dered by employees coming from non clerical cadres should be taken into account for the purpose of determining seniority.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "c411d49149014aab92e387d28195289e_185"}, {"start": 43168, "end": 43337, "text": "This rule attempted to strike a just balance between the conflicting claims of non clerical and clerical staff and it cannot be condemned as arbitrary or discriminatory.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "338aae5c21664d54a55e0f728b54b226_186"}, {"start": 43338, "end": 43387, "text": "Vide: Anand Parkash Saksena vs Union of India.(1)", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "11c84a54c2b54af99fdf9443bd5638eb_187"}, {"start": 43388, "end": 43787, "text": "The last contention of the petitioners was that seniori ty is a civil right and the State cannot interfere with it to the prejudice of an employee without giving an opportuni ty to him to be heard and since the Combined Seniority Scheme adversely affected the seniority of the petitioners in the clerical cadre without giving them an opportunity to represent against it, it was void and inoperative.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "df4b1c5ed18f44a7a7c0e061e05e42bc_188"}, {"start": 43788, "end": 43864, "text": "There are two answers to this contention and each is, in our opinion, fatal.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "30c1e1731e3f48cd8547de90b37eadee_189"}, {"start": 43865, "end": 44130, "text": "In the first place, we do not find from the judgment of the High Court that this contention was at any time advanced before the High Court and, in the circum stance.s, we do not think it would be fight to permit it to be raised for the first time before this Court.", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "7967f4584e8b48ceb2f62fb120957a78_190"}, {"start": 44131, "end": 44228, "text": "Secondly, even if this contention were allowed to be raised, we do not think it can be sustained.", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "b6cd7fada156463d872bd1f8576ffce6_191"}, {"start": 44229, "end": 44334, "text": "Here, there was no question of any existing seniority being disturbed by change in the rule of seniority.", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "ce1cb372b8ed4664a8e153b6a43b64a3_192"}, {"start": 44335, "end": 44589, "text": "The problem was of fitting into the clerical cadre employees coming from non clerical cadres and for that purpose, a new rule was required to be made which would determine the seniority of these new entrants vis a vis those already in the clerical cadre.", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "a0a07114d6264b4191b433e73f296a6d_193"}, {"start": 44590, "end": 44737, "text": "Such rule did not affect seniority and hence there could be no question of giving the petitioners an opportunity to make representation against it.", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "8109b215d6a14843996c360cb2477a58_194"}, {"start": 44738, "end": 44986, "text": "These were the only contentions urged before us against the constitutional validity of the Combined Seniority Scheme and since there is no substance in them, we think that the High Court was in error in striking down the Combined Sen iority Scheme.", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "967de31a74ec4aaea6fcdb6507a1bd16_195"}, {"start": 44987, "end": 45129, "text": "We accordingly allow the appeals, set aside the judgment and order of the High Court and uphold the validity of the Combined Seniority Scheme.", "labels": ["RPC"], "id": "65c0ed7fc83c4855be742c0e24ac8009_196"}, {"start": 45130, "end": 45165, "text": "There will be no order as to costs.", "labels": ["RPC"], "id": "b0a0c44945c8440a8d72e2e28806284b_197"}, {"start": 45166, "end": 45189, "text": "V,P.S. IV, section iii I).", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "e6dfda786986446bb399f69c0ef02d97_76"}, {"start": 12324, "end": 12585, "text": "Emphasis is laid on the \"budhi visesha\" (particular state or condition of the mind) as the decisive factor in producing a severance in status and the declaration is stated to be merely \"abhivyanjika\" or manifestation which might vary according to circumstances.", "labels": ["PRE_RELIED"], "id": "7a1c182c609241489518c17a15f831ac_77"}, {"start": 12586, "end": 12856, "text": "In Suraj Narain vs Iqbal Narain(1) the Judicial Committee made the following categorical statement of the legal position : \"A definite and unambiguous indication by one member of intention to separate himself and to enjoy his share in severalty may amount to separation.", "labels": ["PRE_RELIED"], "id": "af13ac76a9fd40a79a487c372b25eda6_78"}, {"start": 12857, "end": 12937, "text": "But to have that effect the intention must be unequivocal and clearly expressed.", "labels": ["PRE_RELIED"], "id": "cd1aad3f3e264eb69ebdbaa8713645dc_79"}, {"start": 12938, "end": 13243, "text": ". whilst the other is the natural resultant from his decision, the division. and separation of his share which may be arrived at either by private agreement among the parties, or on failure of that, by the intervention of the Court.", "labels": ["PRE_RELIED"], "id": "262e30098ca04b4d909e2c6cc10dfc25_81"}, {"start": 14138, "end": 14592, "text": "Once the decision has been unequivocally expressed and clearly intimated to his co sharers, his right to his right to have his share allocated separately from has a title is unimpeachable; neither the co sharers can question it nor can the Court examine his conscience to find out whether his reasons for separation were well founded or sufficient; the Court has s imply to give effect to his right to have his share allocated separately from the others.", "labels": ["PRE_RELIED"], "id": "5a901e9c45bc428ab44f5269ec6174c4_82"}, {"start": 14593, "end": 15132, "text": "In Syed Kasam vs Jorawar Singh (2), Viscount Cave, in delivering the judgment of the Judicial Committee, observed \"It is settled law that in the case of a joint Hindu family subject to the law of the Mitakshara, a severance of estate is effected by an unequivocal declaration on the part of one of the joint holders of his intention to hold his share separately, even though no actual division takes place : and the commencement of a suit for partition has been held to be sufficient.to _effect a severance in interest even before decree.\"", "labels": ["PRE_RELIED"], "id": "53920007511345e09492ca6137200e26_83"}, {"start": 15133, "end": 15435, "text": "These authorities were quoted with approval by this Court in Addagada Raghavamma vs Addagada Chenchamma(3), and it was held that a member of a joint Hindu family seeking to separate himself from others will have to make known his intention to other members of his family from whom he seeks to separate.", "labels": ["PRE_RELIED"], "id": "6348ecac1eb8426c95dd02aaa2b73e93_84"}, {"start": 15436, "end": 15721, "text": "The (1) I.L.R. (2) I.L.R. "id": "0f00d38e78e842dea7e5d0e9d0acfe24_174"}, {"start": 41182, "end": 41375, "text": "Since, according to him, the canteens are run for the benefit of the staff, the Government has only a general Administration and the canteen employees.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "db42e664d8754af596fc2a917838a14b_229"}, {"start": 51944, "end": 52136, "text": "The letters of appointment issued to the employees make it expressly clear that the employment is non Governmental and purely temporary and does not carry any pensionary or gratu ity benefits.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "eb399e51fae44b26b0004588f223454e_230"}, {"start": 52137, "end": 52299, "text": "The employees recruited further are not sub jected to rigorous standards as to age limit, educational qualifications, medical fitness, character verification etc.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "c63d69f7adb04b569f1dc4fadc1265b1_231"}, {"start": 52300, "end": 52645, "text": "He further submitted that the order dated October 22, 1980 passed by this Court in the case of the employees of the eleven Delhi based non statutory canteens is expressly subject to the liberty given to the Railway Administration to contend in a future appropriate case that they are not railway employees and hence it cannot act as a precedent.", "labels": ["ARG_PETITIONER"], "id": "1b4c5fd62724442889734a9509d1dff5_232"}, {"start": 52646, "end": 52913, "text": "He also contended as he did in the case of the statutory can teen employees, that if the employees engaged in these canteens are treated as Railway servants, the employees engaged in other welfare activities, casual labourers etc. may have also to be treated as such.", "labels": ["ARG_RESPONDENT"], "id": "7c1905aaa9bd4a5897f107081fd25f83_233"}, {"start": 52914, "end": 52961, "text": "29. These arguments can be dealt with together.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "1b78d270aae54e16979fc2afd3d3104a_234"}, {"start": 52962, "end": 53085, "text": "In the first instance, there is hardly any difference between the statutory canteens and non statutory recognised canteens.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "36f1238c478e43f58ca0c0a3d29293cd_235"}, {"start": 53086, "end": 53412, "text": "The statutory canteens are established wherever the railway establishments employ more than 250 persons as is mandatory under the provisions of Section 46 of the Act while non statutory canteens are required to be established under 712 paragraph 2831 of the Railway Estb. Manual where the strength of the staff is 100 or more.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "778af9e87a4d44c1886b653dedb380ce_236"}, {"start": 53413, "end": 53544, "text": "In terms of the said paragraph, the non statutory canteens to be recognised have to be approved of by the Railway Board in advance.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "a9d56daee56148158cf29432cfd847f3_237"}, {"start": 53545, "end": 53555, "text": "Every Rly.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "45e09a4957114e3cba08ad65f48826d6_238"}, {"start": 53556, "end": 53570, "text": "Administration", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "9184b3ec356e4dcc9b5f499248e31680_239"}, {"start": 53571, "end": 53578, "text": "seeking", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "362d2aa05c7c4a85bd599edadddcc2c8_240"}, {"start": 53579, "end": 53602, "text": "to set up such canteens", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "ca837aa842df49acb0d41ffd3fab7484_241"}, {"start": 53603, "end": 53814, "text": "is required to approach the Railway Board for their prior "a83e5b5eb33a49429dc674971cf3ef60_242"}, {"start": 53815, "end": 53943, "text": "It is only when the approval is accorded by the Railway Board that the canteen is treated as a recognised non statutory canteen.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "e56412aea4ec4e12b73e56f33a48de27_243"}, {"start": 53944, "end": 54096, "text": "By the sanction, the details in regard to the number of staff to be employed in the canteen, recurring and non recurring expenditure etc. are regulated.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "4c71f625b6534252a4890c4c15bda82b_244"}, {"start": 54097, "end": 54261, "text": "The only material difference between the statutory canteen and non statutory recognised canteen is that while one is obligatory under the said Act the other is not.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "f91bdb39c8bd4b5982f1d5adb53738c8_245"}, {"start": 54262, "end": 54452, "text": "However, there is no difference in the management of the two types of canteens as is evident from the provisions of paragraphs 2832 and 2833 which respective ly provide for their management.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "c48babf68ffb49b59aac1b8c43740b67_246"}, {"start": 54453, "end": 54918, "text": "Regarding the incidence of cost to be borne by the Railways again, as far as the Manual is concerned, the only additional obligation cast on the Administration, in the case of the statutory canteens is that in addition to the facilities given to the non statuto ry canteens, the Administration has also to meet the statu tory obligations in respect of the expenditure for providing and maintaining canteens arising from the said Act and the rules framed thereunder.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "d7bea2cf26df410eb40a174b88295ee1_247"}, {"start": 54919, "end": 55154, "text": "A perusal of the relevant provi sions shows that the said Act and the rules made thereunder do not make demands on the Administration for more expendi ture than what is provided for in the Railway Manual for the non statutory canteens.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "72f3d2b167ce4fbf897fecd769e92d4b_248"}, {"start": 55155, "end": 55279, "text": "We have already referred to the service conditions applicable to the employees of the statu tory and non statutory canteens.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "398ab6982886437e9eb3ce094450ef25_249"}, {"start": 55280, "end": 55517, "text": "Besides, while discussing the case of the employees in statutory canteens we have pointed out the relevant provisions of the Administrative Instructions on Departmental Canteens in Government Officers and Govt. Industrial Establishments.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "6b3d1cadd04248b6b065ee9515701012_250"}, {"start": 55518, "end": 55607, "text": "These Instructions are applicable to both statutory and nonstatutory recognised canteens.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "a219598483f345858784c1ad377aa101_251"}, {"start": 55608, "end": 55712, "text": "The Instructions do not make any difference be tween the two so far as their applicability is concerned.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "d6cfad5b148e46b29b81ea244fd2c16c_252"}, {"start": 55713, "end": 55872, "text": "In fact these Instructions require that the canteens run by engaging solely part time daily wage workers may be convert ed to departmental canteens (para 1.3).", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "50032d5d4eec470c9145df771455bd83_253"}, {"start": 55873, "end": 56020, "text": "Hence we donot see why any distinction be made between the employees of the two types of canteens so far as their service conditions are concerned.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "87124c2f84014acbad7a69bc8ac87510_254"}, {"start": 56021, "end": 56185, "text": "For this very reason, the two notifications of December 11, 1979 and December 23, 1980 (supra) should also be equally applicable to the employees of these canteens.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "8ce460e06bea44248c10b300ff478c2b_255"}, {"start": 56186, "end": 56284, "text": "If this is so, then these employees would also be entitled to be treated as rail 713 way servants.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "9a5407dcf75e4f1e93116cf703fadcf2_256"}, {"start": 56285, "end": 56452, "text": "A classification made between the employees of the two types of canteens would be unreasonable and will have no rational nexus with the purpose of the classifica tion.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "166c827fec5947a79f67713810fab843_257"}, {"start": 56453, "end": 56749, "text": "Surely it cannot be argued that the employees who otherwise do the same work and work under the same condi tions and under a similar management have to be treated differently merely because the canteen happens to be run at an establishment which employs 250 or less than 250 members of the staff.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "c516c42966514dada18073a85d250a56_258"}, {"start": 56750, "end": 56850, "text": "The smaller strength of the staff may justify a smaller number of the canteen workers to serve them.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "be0bbdf7091b4f8793f3ad8996ff0f85_259"}, {"start": 56851, "end": 56931, "text": "But that does not make any difference to the working conditions of such workers.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "bec0fddb37f44005ac14993529d62d00_260"}, {"start": 56932, "end": 57070, "text": "We have already dealt with the other arguments advanced by Shri Ramaswamy while dealing with the cases of employees in statutory canteens.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "235ecb03391046379b855ec19f3d8494_261"}, {"start": 57071, "end": 57126, "text": "It is not necessary to repeat the said discussion here.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "b001ed30ece9436ca5273865b56ed8d4_262"}, {"start": 57127, "end": 57338, "text": "We are, therefore, of the view that the case of these employees should be treated on par with that of the employees in the statutory canteens and they should also be treated for all purposes as railway servants.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "517fdf3e36414e7fa8fa1dfc3e1d5ee2_263"}, {"start": 57339, "end": 57546, "text": "This is apart from the fact that by an order of this Court the employees of eleven Delhi based non statutory recognised canteens have already been directed to be treated as railway servants for all purposes.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "87b9a7ebebf946e38f7607a837708c91_264"}, {"start": 57547, "end": 57590, "text": "(iii)Non Statutory Non Recognised Canteens:", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "e73379534da14169b08f0f19644325d9_265"}, {"start": 57591, "end": 57830, "text": "The difference between the non statutory recognised and non statutory nonrcognised canteen is that these canteens are not started with the approval of the Railway Board as re quired under paragraph 2831 of the Railway Establishment Manual.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "e2647401fc464995a7f76120c67801d7_266"}, {"start": 57831, "end": 57960, "text": "Though, they are started in the premises belonging to the Railways they are so started with the permission of the local officers.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "187c315ba1e74e89a3808da1a15f261f_267"}, {"start": 57961, "end": 58105, "text": "They are not required to be managed either as per the provisions of the Railway Establishment Manual or the Administrative Instructions (Supra).", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "6f7f2b56330e45e9be7f3430c3bb7da8_268"}, {"start": 58106, "end": 58252, "text": "There is no obligation on the Railway Administration to provide them with any facilities including the furniture, utensils, electricity and water.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "ffe538a52b674ff989b342eb47b6eefb_269"}, {"start": 58253, "end": 58339, "text": "These canteens are further not enti tled to nor are they given any subsidies or loans.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "ee1ad5f9b1cd43338ea8c9d8d6313284_270"}, {"start": 58340, "end": 58460, "text": "They are run by private contractors and there is no continuity either of the contractors or the workers engaged by them.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "809a92979f324159a415eb19c7571b10_271"}, {"start": 58461, "end": 58521, "text": "Very often than not the workers go out with the contractors.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "b5687c2993964611864eadf09fd3c5b9_272"}, {"start": 58522, "end": 58628, "text": "There is further no obligation cast even on the local of fices to supervise the working of these canteens.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "cd7edf0056074d9a936aade86c98d181_273"}, {"start": 58629, "end": 58727, "text": "No rules whatsoever are applicable to the recruitment of the workers and their service conditions.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "ad94f5c30d8c4749b0d0d1d74534d506_274"}, {"start": 58728, "end": 58994, "text": "The canteens are run more or less on ad hoc basis, the Railway Administration having no control on their working neither is there a record of these canteens or of the contractors who run them who keep on changing, much less of the workers engaged in these can teens.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "3732a3def3d24c47b65e0587dc93f815_275"}, {"start": 58995, "end": 59146, "text": "In the circumstances we are of the view of 714 that the workers engaged in these canteens are not entitled to claim the status of the railway servants.", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "0607bd2ab0af463a9ab0dfd05bf8b888_276"}, {"start": 59147, "end": 59382, "text": "The result, therefore, is that the workers engaged in the statutory canteens as well as those engaged in non statutory recognised canteens in the Railway Establishments are railway employees and they are entitled to be treated as such.", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "1ce2e322b58f4b409d2ad727b072e2bf_277"}, {"start": 59383, "end": 59555, "text": "The Railway Board has already treated the employees of all statutory and eleven Delhi based non statutory recog nised canteens as railway employees w.e.f. October 22, 1980.", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "239b459f66324a1a9dc75fdf0deb45a6_278"}, {"start": 59556, "end": 59685, "text": "The employees of the other non statutory recognised canteens will, however, be treated as railway employees w.e.f. April 1, 1990.", "labels": ["RPC"], "id": "ddabe60bec534d02ab77bc6630d347ec_279"}, {"start": 59686, "end": 59883, "text": "They would, therefore, be entitled to all benefits as such railway employees with effect from the said date, according to the service conditions prescribed for them under the relevant rules/orders.", "labels": ["RPC"], "id": "c30ed3227330448a8c933fa794730a56_280"}, {"start": 59884, "end": 60004, "text": "The Writ Petitions and appeals of these employees are allowed to the above extent accordingly with no order as to costs.", "labels": ["RPC"], "id": "ab1b2f416aea40f280257e2273ec86a4_281"}, {"start": 60005, "end": 60115, "text": "As far as the employees in non statutory non recog nised canteens are concerned their petitions are dismissed.", "labels": ["RPC"], "id": "1900818ae41e43c19d88e5ee70b6868f_282"}, {"start": 60116, "end": 60161, "text": "There will, however, be no order as to costs.", "labels": ["RPC"], "id": "db5d2e2be81241c3af1e9fdaadf70fe8_283"}, {"start": 60162, "end": 60199, "text": "R.S.S. "c2fe49cc1c7a4668b4327fa3874f35be_23"}, {"start": 4398, "end": 4573, "text": "It is submitted that no objective criterion is possible in that context, and the selection must perforce be left to the absolute and unfettered choice of the State Government.", "labels": ["ARG_PETITIONER"], "id": "99a75c6e988244e4b3454b678f3bdb6a_24"}, {"start": 4574, "end": 4724, "text": "The Andhra Pradesh Government relies on G.O.M. No. 508, M & H dated July 27, 1979, which brings the scheme into effect from the academic year 1979 80.", "labels": ["ARG_PETITIONER"], "id": "340fab49d07b4d51aa55696d80794f06_25"}, {"start": 4725, "end": 4921, "text": "It expressly provides that the selection of candidates for such nominations is excluded from the purview of the Selection Committees constituted for admission to the M.B.B.S. Course in the States.", "labels": ["ARG_PETITIONER"], "id": "372218739e864b528c58096320ade36f_26"}, {"start": 4922, "end": 5003, "text": "At the outset, we may dispose of an objection taken on behalf of the respondents.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "b8631d66bdce415cad3b3f207688e969_27"}, {"start": 5004, "end": 5292, "text": "It is pointed out that the petitioners in the writ petitions and the appellants in the civil appeals applied merely for 989 admission to the Medical Colleges of the home State and have not alleged anywhere that they applied for nomination to a seat in a Medical College outside the State.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "e4a83f69dee8442d9a23b542b71d8594_28"}, {"start": 5293, "end": 5574, "text": "It is urged that inasmuch as the scheme of nominations to Medical Colleges outside the State is distinct altogether from the scheme of admissions to Medical Colleges within the State the petitioners and the appellants are not entitled to question the validity of those nominations.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "283207a401af4daeaafc153852cafe62_29"}, {"start": 5575, "end": 5651, "text": "We are referred to Chitra Ghosh and Another vs Union of India and Others.(1)", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "44315c86a9304dd8ad21e3e5679b847e_30"}, {"start": 5652, "end": 5803, "text": "In the civil appeals before us, however, we find that some of the appellants did apply for nomination to a seat in a Medical College outside the State.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "8fcb847bc2f44574a1e5947918ca4b40_31"}, {"start": 5804, "end": 5986, "text": "Besides, the Andhra Pradesh High Court has elaborately considered the question on its merits, and it seems desirable in the circumstances to pronounce our opinion on the controversy.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "3cd0cd52e40842d18795ee508c4b4f82_32"}, {"start": 5987, "end": 6014, "text": "The objection is overruled.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "f89fe461f97049a6b28db30d0e0274f5_33"}, {"start": 6015, "end": 6326, "text": "For the purpose of these cases, we shall proceed on the assumption that national integration, which is undeniably in itself a highly commendable and laudable objective, will be effectively served by a policy encouraging the admission of candidates of one State to seats in the Medical Colleges of another State.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "e3d331193d534441a3b9a8e4f3732ee5_34"}, {"start": 6327, "end": 6560, "text": "After considering the matter carefully, we confess, we are unable to subscribe to the view that the selection of candidates for that purpose must remain in the unlimited discretion and the uncontrolled choice of the State Government.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "c185f1ebcccd45768535a2c611164fd9_35"}, {"start": 6561, "end": 6872, "text": "We think it beyond dispute that the exercise of all administrative power vested in public authority must be structured within a system of controls informed by both relevance and reason relevance in relation to the object which it seeks to serve, and reason in regard to the manner in which it attempts to do so.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "bc09ff4142f249b5846bb6cd97fe9787_36"}, {"start": 6873, "end": 7040, "text": "Wherever the exercise of such power affects individual rights, there can be no greater assurance protecting its valid exercise than its governance by these twin tests.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "84fe5bebd83c42f6bfad55d599c50f7f_37"}, {"start": 7041, "end": 7191, "text": "A stream of case law radiating from the now well known decision of this Court in Maneka Gandhi vs Union of India(2) has laid down in clear terms that.", "labels": ["PRE_RELIED"], "id": "d70d8677f28244e79fffaa22018fe589_38"}, {"start": 7192, "end": 7319, "text": "Article 14 of the Constitution is violated by powers and procedures which in themselves result in unfairness and arbitrariness.", "labels": ["PRE_RELIED"], "id": "6e64f95981f642cfa6c008ff9880324b_39"}, {"start": 7320, "end": 7562, "text": "It must be remembered that our entire constitutional system is founded in the Rule of Law, and in any system so designed it is impossible to conceive of legitimate power which is arbitrary in character and travels beyond the bounds of reason.", "labels": ["PRE_RELIED"], "id": "d0fe22e1204c46cf970d1fe2978d7a5a_40"}, {"start": 7563, "end": 7832, "text": "To contend that 990 the choice of a candidate selected on the basis of his ability to project the culture and ethos of his home State must necessarily be left to unfettered discretion of executive authority is to deny a fundamental principle of our constitutional life.", "labels": ["PRE_RELIED"], "id": "f69120f61f9844d984d427e83c9e2bc8_41"}, {"start": 7833, "end": 7998, "text": "We do not doubt that in the realm of administrative power the element of discretion may properly find place, where the statute or the nature of the power intends so.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "0a04d1b8fcee499cbf23842b31e7f92f_42"}, {"start": 7999, "end": 8237, "text": "But there is a well recognised distinction between an administrative power to be exercised within defined limits in the reasonable discretion of designated authority and the vesting of an absolute and uncontrolled power in such authority.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "427e5dc1250f433d86fe5c4901c121c3_43"}, {"start": 8238, "end": 8355, "text": "One is power controlled by law countenanced by the Constitution, the other falls outside the Constitution altogether.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "833c6d01b1864730852f32cb2b41b8c2_44"}, {"start": 8356, "end": 8558, "text": "Proceeding from there, it is evident that if the State Government desires to advance the objective of national integration it must adopt procedures which are reasonable and are related to the objective.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "5ae46701752740b7be95406f527339f4_45"}, {"start": 8559, "end": 8671, "text": "In this Age of Reason, all law must measure upto that standard, and necessarily so also must all executive acts.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "fc101e4787e64388b95b9cc81566e36d_46"}, {"start": 8672, "end": 8939, "text": "Viewed in this context, the claim of the State Government in these cases that the nature of the objective and the means adopted to serve it entitle it legitimately to vest in itself an absolute power in choosing candidates for nomination cannot be allowed to prevail.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "27a7df02ea5d4f9d9705dd96737b695c_47"}, {"start": 8940, "end": 9163, "text": "It is incumbent on the State Government to adopt a criterion or restrict its power by reference to norms which, while designed to achieve its object, nevertheless confine the flow of that power within constitutional limits.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "1df83461b4084b49875361cfe947eee8_48"}, {"start": 9164, "end": 9257, "text": "We are not convinced that an adequate system of standards cannot be devised for that purpose.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "5612b7be5a084bd0a60e9da3e90dabf9_49"}, {"start": 9258, "end": 9431, "text": "Tested on the touchstone of our constitutional values, the claim of the State Government to the content of the power assumed by it must, in our opinion, be declared invalid.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "25c7d96d42b447c18fda81c7a033fbec_50"}, {"start": 9432, "end": 9679, "text": "Now, the selection of an appropriate procedure lies ordinarily within the domain of administrative policy, and when the objective can be fulfilled by more than one constitutionally valid method, the selection must be left to administrative choice.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "510dce7b191c436c994b8addb1b35fab_51"}, {"start": 9680, "end": 9765, "text": "The Courts are generally concerned merely with the legal validity of the choice made.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "e3a7ebab7ddd40938ed31b8683f05230_52"}, {"start": 9766, "end": 9993, "text": "We think it desirable, therefore, to leave it to the Medical Council of India to formulate a proper constitutional basis for determining the selection of candidates for nomination to seats in Medical Colleges outside the State.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "df5eae02981c4d84b782e7362983d8e8_53"}, {"start": 9994, "end": 10242, "text": "The problem is one which needs to be tackled at the national level, having regard to the objective which is sought to be achieved and to the circumstance that it calls for reciprocal arrangements between Medical Colleges throughout the 991 country.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "174410c0d92746b59539302ae4ba8262_54"}, {"start": 10243, "end": 10633, "text": "Until a policy is so formulated and adopted and concrete criteria are embodied in the procedure to be selected, we direct that nominations be made by following the procedure of selecting candidates strictly on the basis of merit, the candidates nominated being those, in order of merit, immediately next below the candidates selected for admission to the Medical Colleges of the home State.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "ca85a192e3ea4144ba00c7e825b0e831_55"}, {"start": 10634, "end": 11030, "text": "Before concluding it is desirable to advert to the contention raised on behalf of the respondents that as the State Government finances medical education within the State it is entitled to exercise an absolute discretion in the nomination of candidates to seats in Medical Colleges outside the State, specially when the nomination is part of a reciprocal arrangement between the different States.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "9e676b0777bf44a286df0d2c04e872ed_56"}, {"start": 11031, "end": 11227, "text": "In our opinion, the contention cannot be regarded as valid in view of what has been laid down now by this Court in Ramana Dayaram Shetty vs The International Airport Authority of India and Ors.(1)", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "860c2e45d3e14696993e507ceaeb5556_57"}, {"start": 11228, "end": 11467, "text": "Considerable and vehement argument has been addressed on behalf of the petitioners and the appellants that we should make an order revoking the nominations already made by the Jammu and Kashmir Government and the Andhra Pradesh Government.", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "f3160fff327947d588eaab9ae76aca27_58"}, {"start": 11468, "end": 11495, "text": "We do not propose to do so.", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "1d421f75b6c34bd483e887f85651a444_59"}, {"start": 11496, "end": 11702, "text": "The State Government proceeded in the bona fide belief that the procedure adopted by it was just and proper, the basis being one which appears to have been uniformly adopted by all the participating States.", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "f094009239a94ef2904780209c0514d0_60"}, {"start": 11703, "end": 11804, "text": "Besides, the candidates nominated have already covered a substantial part of their course of studies.", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "fc7419599e0a4be980893d79dd6f8773_61"}, {"start": 11805, "end": 11913, "text": "These considerations considered cumulatively dissuade us from interfering with the nominations already made.", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "1f198c1c95c84d8b888db8e7a4c16e7a_62"}, {"start": 11914, "end": 12171, "text": "In the result, we allow the writ petitions and the civil appeals insofar that the principle adopted by the State Governments of nominating candidates in their absolute and unfettered choice to seats in Medical Colleges outside the State is declared invalid.", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "6cad656f483c4bd2b0a62f06d1b547f9_63"}, {"start": 12172, "end": 12422, "text": "The Medical Council of India is directed to formulate a proper constitutional basis for determining the selection of candidates for nomination to seats in Medical Colleges outside the State in the light of the observations contained in this judgment.", "labels": ["RPC"], "id": "822188d280a441f1902dffd06a704ab2_64"}, {"start": 12423, "end": 12762, "text": "Until a policy is so formulated and concrete criteria are embodied in the procedure selected, the nominations shall be made by selecting candidates strictly on the basis of merit, the candidates nominated being those, 992 in order of merit, immediately below the candidates selected for admission to the Medical Colleges of the home State.", "labels": ["RPC"], "id": "99a4038996194a2996abbd0a804fc091_65"}, {"start": 12763, "end": 12857, "text": "The judgment dated December 31, 1982 of the Andhra Pradesh High Court is modified accordingly.", "labels": ["RPC"], "id": "5a413abe08514b519cf3b17ebf56a11f_66"}, {"start": 12858, "end": 12924, "text": "In the circumstances of these cases, we make no order as to costs.", "labels": ["RPC"], "id": "bb5b48be18fa4d6e99c1be7ec2da7724_67"}, {"start": 12925, "end": 13005, "text": "A copy of this judgment and order shall be sent to the Medical Council of India.", "labels": ["RPC"], "id": "a82020a7d9284d4f884e2e6502f008b9_68"}, {"start": 13006, "end": 13047, "text": "H.S.K. Appeals & Petition partly allowed.", "labels": ["NONE"], "id": "1860f04ebaf6499dbd4ef2f84a8f30b9_69"}]

Road, Calcutta.", "labels": ["FAC"], "id": "19d775698ca543919209fd3cd24d5b0f_5"}, {"start": 473, "end": 634, "text": "In the issue of a Hindi newspaper, \"Sanmarg\", dated September 14, 1967 he had the following advertisement published: \"New Life, New Vigour, New Spirit, New Wave.", "labels": ["FAC"], "id": "10c1bff80f184bae8aef7d1371677c84_6"}, {"start": 635, "end": 722, "text": "If you want a cure, see today well known world famous experienced registered Physician.", "labels": ["FAC"], "id": "098fc247347c4e79a4e94d93f955497e_7"}, {"start": 723, "end": 948, "text": "Special diseases such as oldness in youth, all sorts of defects in nerves, or weakness laziness are treated with full responsibility, with new methods, new machines of science and electric treatment and are cured permanently.", "labels": ["FAC"], "id": "9cf71bcb35194f3d91d4276ba512be04_8"}, {"start": 949, "end": 1126, "text": "\" In behalf of this advertisement, the appellant was prosecuted under section 7 read with section 3 of the Drugs and Magic Remedies (objectionable Advertisements Act 21 of 1954.", "labels": ["FAC"], "id": "0254fb28e89d45dcbd9c040f22802b49_9"}, {"start": 1127, "end": 1275, "text": "The learned Presidency Magistrate, 8th Court, Calcutta convicted the appellant of the aforesaid charge and sentenced him to pay a fine of Rs. 100/ .", "labels": ["RLC"], "id": "99a9edb8a93d441d971f539957d081fe_10"}, {"start": 1276, "end": 1419, "text": "The order of conviction and sentence having been confirmed by the High Court of Calcutta, the appellant has filed this appeal by special leave.", "labels": ["RLC"], "id": "20dfaacee17d4383957a99919d6e1e8e_11"}, {"start": 1420, "end": 1823, "text": "The Drugs and Magic Remedies (objectionable Advertisements) Act provides by section 3, in so far as relevant, that no person shall take part in the publication of any advertisement \"referring to any drug in terms which suggest or are calculated to lead to the use of that drug\" for the maintenance or improvement of the capacity of human beings for sexual pleasure or the diagnosis, cure or treatment E.", "labels": ["STA"], "id": "ecec1770c4f840ffa45913ad5fc53615_12"}, {"start": 1824, "end": 1889, "text": "Of any disease or condition specified in the Schedule to the Act.", "labels": ["STA"], "id": "fb1f0f4afb484d9d8fe913034569ecf4_13"}, {"start": 1890, "end": 1959, "text": "Item 14 of the Schedule refers to \"Disorders of the nervous system '.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "df34ca978b2f4f01a319b20f57333cc9_14"}, {"start": 1960, "end": 2043, "text": "Section 7 of the Act makes it penal to contravene any of the provisions of the Act.", "labels": ["STA"], "id": "3d68e3691e9349f780a68b33e339fb58_15"}, {"start": 2044, "end": 2218, "text": "The contention of the appellant was and before us is that the particular advertisement does not refer to any \"drug\" and therefore the provisions of the Act are not attracted.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "93ce770cee9c4d3e89eb1781620b6e39_16"}, {"start": 2219, "end": 2325, "text": "For appreciating this contention, it is necessary to refer to section 2(b) of the Act which runs thus: \"2.", "labels": ["STA"], "id": "cad2c6002f6b4bf887927a92746d87cb_17"}, {"start": 2326, "end": 2928, "text": "In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires, (a) * * * * (b) \"drug\" includes (i) a medicine for the internal or external use of human beings or animals; (ii) any substance intended to be used for or in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment or prevention of disease in human beings or animals; (iii) any article, other than food, intended to affect or influence in any way the structure or any 784 organic function of the body of human beings or animals; (iv) any article intended for use as a component of any medicine, substance or article, referred to in sub clauses (i), (ii) and (iii).\"", "labels": ["STA"], "id": "a2db20d1cb7c4f9e9973d63b8b5ae3ca_18"}, {"start": 2929, "end": 3216, "text": "The learned Magistrate as well as the High Court have taken the view that the advertisement in question; refers to a drug as defined by section 2(b) (ii) above as \"machines of science\" are a \"substance\" intended to be used in the diagnosis, cure or treatment of diseases in human beings.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "71c21640708a44fda4568fe90868f8da_19"}, {"start": 3217, "end": 3413, "text": "We do not propose to examine the correctness of this view because it seems to us clear that, in any event, the impugn ed part of the advertisement refers to a drug as defined by section 2(b)(iii).", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "a9d9dc618c794283b07e62a347bf13f7_20"}, {"start": 3414, "end": 3593, "text": "Any article, other than food, which is intended to affect or influence in any way any organic function of the body of a human being is a drug within the meaning of that provision.", "labels": ["STA"], "id": "0905ba7c37564035909e401260205045_21"}, {"start": 3594, "end": 3800, "text": "The so called \"machines of science\" or of \"electric treatment\" whose magically curative properties were advertised by the appellant are Articles intended to influence the organic function of the human body.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "2b50c9a8a5b94ef0b0c6f504132fe19a_22"}, {"start": 3801, "end": 3932, "text": "Indeed, the very claim of the appellant is that by the use of these machines he could cure nervous diseases amongst other ailments.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "2f6f68a512f04ee29ddb18762441b224_23"}, {"start": 3933, "end": 4026, "text": "That a machine is an \"article\" requires no great learning either to expound or to understand.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "06c665bb9d6d458a9cc234ef58a2b3df_24"}, {"start": 4027, "end": 4197, "text": "A machine is a tangible thing which can both be seen and felt and as such it answers the description of an 'article ' within the meaning of section 2(b) (iii) of the Act.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "a0a54902ed304009bf41bdf9b13816fc_25"}, {"start": 4198, "end": 4337, "text": "The 'Shorter oxford English Dictionary ' (Ed. 1964, Vol. I, p. 102) says that 'article ' means. inter alia, \"a piece of goods or property\".", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "4f647834330e49c2958a6dcd3c3ed475_26"}, {"start": 4338, "end": 4480, "text": "Webster 's 'New World Dictionary ' defines an 'article ' as a \"commodity\" and 'commodity ' as \"any useful thing\" or \"any article of commerce\".", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "75f239d34ea54de79e1bfe25d1d391b1_27"}, {"start": 4481, "end": 4511, "text": "(See Ed. 1962 pp. 83 and 295).", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "f8ac1c96559647208182301673b4d8e7_28"}, {"start": 4512, "end": 4586, "text": "Putting it simply, a \"machine\" is a \"thing\" and is therefore an \"article\".", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "2df42e5ef9234279853f2140aab4369e_29"}, {"start": 4587, "end": 4698, "text": "Law may not all be commonsense and logic may not be the life of law but commonsense is not taboo in law courts.", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "167737c29f6f48bf9cd0f64afcb5d6bb_30"}, {"start": 4699, "end": 4802, "text": "A machine is after all intended to be and is conceived as a useful thing and is therefore an \"article\".", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "eb30d35f2348419fb57244c71ed850b6_31"}, {"start": 4803, "end": 5013, "text": "The Statement of objects and Reasons to the Act says that many an advertisement causes the ignorant and the unwary \"to resort to quacks who indulge in such advertisements for treatments which cause great harm\".", "labels": ["ANALYSIS"], "id": "d8bcd7078ea947189399fb66fd841728_32"}, {"start": 5014, "end": 5242, "text": "The appellant may not be a quack, so will be assume, but his \"machines of science\" designed to confer on man kind the blessings of 'New Life, New Vigour, New Spirit, New Wave\" are most likely to trap the ignorant and the unwary.", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "0eafc98ab1ac4191a0bb51e035ceccb9_33"}, {"start": 5243, "end": 5424, "text": "The articles of commerce which he has benefully advertised must, as far as possible and without doing violence to the language of the Act, be brought within the mischief of the Act.", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "bfd8e5712cbe4d56916bed94a9cbddbf_34"}, {"start": 5425, "end": 5535, "text": "It does no violence either to commonsense or to rules of interpretation to say that a machine is an \"article\".", "labels": ["RATIO"], "id": "2e66ec98c61c47439e825c03bed5de09_35"}, {"start": 5536, "end": 5649, "text": "In the result, we confirm the judgment of the High Court, though for a different reason, and dismiss this appeal.", "labels": ["RPC"], "id": "edf9481c28ca4144ad0210231285d589_36"}, {"start": 5650, "end": 5674, "text": "P.B.R.
